DOC.brief_summary: Aim of the present study is twofold. - First we want to evaluate the effect of mobilization on acute postoperative pain - Second to test weather chances in pain sensitivity are occurring following surgery and mobilization after total knee arthroplasty
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Mobilization on Acute Postoperative Pain and Nociceptive Function
DOC.detailed_description: Little is known about the effect of mobilization on acute postoperative pain and mobilization induced pain, and if altered pain sensitivity occur under these circumstances. - First we want to evaluate the effect of mobilization on acute postoperative pain using the visual analog scale (VAS) - Second to test weather chances in pain sensitivity are occurring following surgery and mobilization after total knee arthroplasty, using two simple tools, the Pain Matcher and a Pressure Algometer.
DOC.criteria: Patients scheduled for total unilateral knee arthroplasty Cognitive dysfunction or peripheral / central neurological dysfunction inconsistent with protocol completing Alcohol and medical abuse (as defined by the National Health Service of Denmark Daily use of opioids or glucocorticoids
